PROJECT ENGINEER
Check www.scientificsearch.com for all of our current openings.
JOB SUMMARY:
Lead the design effort and serve as the technical focal point for all phases of a project (estimating, sales, manufacture, and set-up of equipment).

REPORTS TO: President
DIRECTS WORK FOR: Engineering Coordinator
RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER FUNCTIONS:

Manufacturing:
The Project Engineer is responsible for coordinating the design and manufacturing function. This requires extended communications during the design phase as well as throughout production with the following elements within manufacturing and for the main purposes as stated:

Materials Manager: Producibility of equipment as designed, review of the Bill-of Material, and resolution of technical problems encountered during manufacture.


Purchasing: Review of the Bill-of-Material in terms of quantity, types, availability, substitutability, and value analysis.


Planning and Scheduling: Design schedule (planned vs. actual) anticipated date that design will be completed and released/approved for manufacture. Rescheduling when necessary because of the need for redesign.


Sales:
Providing design, material selection and data to be used for quoting a job; following up on customer requests and additions, changes with data as needed; advising and providing impacts of any changes to proposal or order once accepted.
Providing constant communication with sales as to the overall progress of the job and any implications that needed for customer updates.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS:

The responsibilities and tasks of this position are as follows, but not limited to:

Maintain the knowledge base which consists of, but is not limited to, processes, documentation, engineering change orders, bills of material, product tables and system logs. Create and evaluate the documentation used in production.
Ability to design to meet requirements, see those requirements are satisfied, while balancing the constraints of time and money.


Must be able to convert customer requirements into design that will result in a finished product that will meet customer’s expectations, be delivered when expected, and at the agreed upon cost.


Responsible for answering technical questions and resolving technical problems regarding the design, operation, and reliability of the subject piece of equipment.


Oversees various phases in the design cycle and coordinates functions with other departments.
Responsible for estimating the hours required for the design effort.


Provides technical assistance to the Operations Manager and Sales Representatives during the sales phase of the project.


Ensures that all deviations from standard or previous designs are annotated and adequately estimated and communicates the cost implications with sales so that the added costs are incorporated into the final sales price of the equipment.


Reviews and signs-off on the final Sales Order, notifies the President or Operations Manager of any deviations from the proposed/agreed upon technical specifications.


Responsible for the design of the equipment, development of customer and internal drawings (utilizing existing drawings whenever possible and their relationship to GPS). Creates the Bill-of-Material or directs support staff to create.


Creates the design schedule, establishes milestones, and manages the design effort to ensure quality and timeliness of the completed design package; or is directly responsible for directing support staff on these tasks and supervises to ensure the outcome.


Utilizes travelers used for tracking engineering work - clock in/out in ProfitKey.


Attends status meetings and provides inputs regarding status of the design. Reports problems and provides solutions with specific action items and due dates.


Minimizes engineering design time to maintain projected profit levels.


Serves as the primary focal point for all technical communications with the customer.
Keeps current with all industry standard specifications and regulating requirements for incorporation into products.


Provides a technical input for any Make/Buy decisions.


Establishes and maintains a design baseline and manages change orders:


Maintains communication with sales rep and any other production staff and is responsible for acting on any communications from the customer that may be categorized as design changes.
Notifies the Operations Manager of all communications and assess the impact of any design changes in terms of cost, delivery time, and quality of designs.
Provides inputs to estimates for change orders.
Obtains final decision from Operations Manager.


Responds to all shop floor feedback regarding technical problems encountered or improvements suggested during manufacture. Manages the problem resolution/suggested improvement process.
Inspects incoming equipment and provides technical expertise as needed or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Completes FAT prior to shipment or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Present during the start-up of equipment at the customer’s facility when directed by the Operations Manager or President.
Create and maintains manuals for company products to be used for installation of equipment.


Creates manuals for all custom jobs or components or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Resolves all technical problems, establishes a data base for identifying and analyzing technical problems with an emphasis on future prevention and design improvements utilizing TQM/SPC concepts and techniques.


Assists in the development of the GPS System Specifications; provides updated data to be entered into system. Helps to create and implement plan for entering data and maintaining parts and product information as needed to ensure system is maintained as a accurate resource for quotes.


Provides direction and technical assistance to lower level engineering tasks such as, but not limited to drafting.


Signs-off/approves all drawings and revisions to drawings.


Assist in the development of marketing materials to support marketing campaigns, literature, and trade shows.


Creates policies and procedures unique to the Engineering function.


Maintains CAD and SolidWorks databases and ensure accurate and timely retrieval of all engineering data.


Integrate Engineering efforts with part numbers, and Bill-of-Material structures or directs staff to complete.


Creates a system to maximize standardization of company products and to effectively deviate from standard designs when necessary.


Designs and maintains a system to ensure the continuous improvement of the engineering function at company and to establish company as a leader in state-of-the-art technology regarding its various product lines.


Manage the transferring of our 2D CAD system to 3D (SolidWorks).


Establishes the policies and procedures for tasks within this role to be performed on a continuing basis for any of the above tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS and SKILLS REQUIRED:
Education level:
 BS in Mechanical Engineering Degree or related area in Engineering


Experience:
5+ years experience working in a similar role or within an engineering firm or department that required similar tasks.
10+ yrs experience with Auto CAD; 5 yrs+ experience with SolidWorks


Specific skills:
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and Outlook)
Proficient in Auto CAD and SolidWorks
Experience with ERP systems required.
Project Management training and experience as Project Manager or in a role with responsibility of managing projects preferred
Must be able to support multiple efforts and track progress against timelines
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional organization and time management skills
Attention to detail
Ability to quickly learn new processes and procedures
Demonstrated ability to make logical decisions
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.


Personal characteristics:
Sense of urgency and ability to withstand demanding work flow.
Patient with solid work ethic; able to deal with routine and repetitive tasks.
Hands-on, results oriented attitude
Capacity to handle fast paced and changing environments
Able to remain flexible and adaptable to change

PROJECT ENGINEER
Check www.scientificsearch.com for all of our current openings.
JOB SUMMARY:
Lead the design effort and serve as the technical focal point for all phases of a project (estimating, sales, manufacture, and set-up of equipment).

REPORTS TO: President
DIRECTS WORK FOR: Engineering Coordinator
RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER FUNCTIONS:

Manufacturing:
The Project Engineer is responsible for coordinating the design and manufacturing function. This requires extended communications during the design phase as well as throughout production with the following elements within manufacturing and for the main purposes as stated:

Materials Manager: Producibility of equipment as designed, review of the Bill-of Material, and resolution of technical problems encountered during manufacture.


Purchasing: Review of the Bill-of-Material in terms of quantity, types, availability, substitutability, and value analysis.


Planning and Scheduling: Design schedule (planned vs. actual) anticipated date that design will be completed and released/approved for manufacture. Rescheduling when necessary because of the need for redesign.


Sales:
Providing design, material selection and data to be used for quoting a job; following up on customer requests and additions, changes with data as needed; advising and providing impacts of any changes to proposal or order once accepted.
Providing constant communication with sales as to the overall progress of the job and any implications that needed for customer updates.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS:

The responsibilities and tasks of this position are as follows, but not limited to:

Maintain the knowledge base which consists of, but is not limited to, processes, documentation, engineering change orders, bills of material, product tables and system logs. Create and evaluate the documentation used in production.
Ability to design to meet requirements, see those requirements are satisfied, while balancing the constraints of time and money.


Must be able to convert customer requirements into design that will result in a finished product that will meet customer’s expectations, be delivered when expected, and at the agreed upon cost.


Responsible for answering technical questions and resolving technical problems regarding the design, operation, and reliability of the subject piece of equipment.


Oversees various phases in the design cycle and coordinates functions with other departments.
Responsible for estimating the hours required for the design effort.


Provides technical assistance to the Operations Manager and Sales Representatives during the sales phase of the project.


Ensures that all deviations from standard or previous designs are annotated and adequately estimated and communicates the cost implications with sales so that the added costs are incorporated into the final sales price of the equipment.


Reviews and signs-off on the final Sales Order, notifies the President or Operations Manager of any deviations from the proposed/agreed upon technical specifications.


Responsible for the design of the equipment, development of customer and internal drawings (utilizing existing drawings whenever possible and their relationship to GPS). Creates the Bill-of-Material or directs support staff to create.


Creates the design schedule, establishes milestones, and manages the design effort to ensure quality and timeliness of the completed design package; or is directly responsible for directing support staff on these tasks and supervises to ensure the outcome.


Utilizes travelers used for tracking engineering work - clock in/out in ProfitKey.


Attends status meetings and provides inputs regarding status of the design. Reports problems and provides solutions with specific action items and due dates.


Minimizes engineering design time to maintain projected profit levels.


Serves as the primary focal point for all technical communications with the customer.
Keeps current with all industry standard specifications and regulating requirements for incorporation into products.


Provides a technical input for any Make/Buy decisions.


Establishes and maintains a design baseline and manages change orders:


Maintains communication with sales rep and any other production staff and is responsible for acting on any communications from the customer that may be categorized as design changes.
Notifies the Operations Manager of all communications and assess the impact of any design changes in terms of cost, delivery time, and quality of designs.
Provides inputs to estimates for change orders.
Obtains final decision from Operations Manager.


Responds to all shop floor feedback regarding technical problems encountered or improvements suggested during manufacture. Manages the problem resolution/suggested improvement process.
Inspects incoming equipment and provides technical expertise as needed or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Completes FAT prior to shipment or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Present during the start-up of equipment at the customer’s facility when directed by the Operations Manager or President.
Create and maintains manuals for company products to be used for installation of equipment.


Creates manuals for all custom jobs or components or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Resolves all technical problems, establishes a data base for identifying and analyzing technical problems with an emphasis on future prevention and design improvements utilizing TQM/SPC concepts and techniques.


Assists in the development of the GPS System Specifications; provides updated data to be entered into system. Helps to create and implement plan for entering data and maintaining parts and product information as needed to ensure system is maintained as a accurate resource for quotes.


Provides direction and technical assistance to lower level engineering tasks such as, but not limited to drafting.


Signs-off/approves all drawings and revisions to drawings.


Assist in the development of marketing materials to support marketing campaigns, literature, and trade shows.


Creates policies and procedures unique to the Engineering function.


Maintains CAD and SolidWorks databases and ensure accurate and timely retrieval of all engineering data.


Integrate Engineering efforts with part numbers, and Bill-of-Material structures or directs staff to complete.


Creates a system to maximize standardization of company products and to effectively deviate from standard designs when necessary.


Designs and maintains a system to ensure the continuous improvement of the engineering function at company and to establish company as a leader in state-of-the-art technology regarding its various product lines.


Manage the transferring of our 2D CAD system to 3D (SolidWorks).


Establishes the policies and procedures for tasks within this role to be performed on a continuing basis for any of the above tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS and SKILLS REQUIRED:
Education level:
 BS in Mechanical Engineering Degree or related area in Engineering


Experience:
5+ years experience working in a similar role or within an engineering firm or department that required similar tasks.
10+ yrs experience with Auto CAD; 5 yrs+ experience with SolidWorks


Specific skills:
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and Outlook)
Proficient in Auto CAD and SolidWorks
Experience with ERP systems required.
Project Management training and experience as Project Manager or in a role with responsibility of managing projects preferred
Must be able to support multiple efforts and track progress against timelines
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional organization and time management skills
Attention to detail
Ability to quickly learn new processes and procedures
Demonstrated ability to make logical decisions
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.


Personal characteristics:
Sense of urgency and ability to withstand demanding work flow.
Patient with solid work ethic; able to deal with routine and repetitive tasks.
Hands-on, results oriented attitude
Capacity to handle fast paced and changing environments
Able to remain flexible and adaptable to change

Job Description Summary
Performs the calibration and validation of test and data analysis equipment and systems used for clinical research, trials and product testing. Assists in equipment selection, specification and negotiation of competitive pricing. Maintains all documentation pertaining to qualification and validation. May develop procedures and/or protocols. Also serves as information resource for validation technicians, contractors and vendors. Job Purpose:
Support Compliance Projects and Programs

Design, Author, and Execute Computerized System Validation (CSV) – according to GAMP 5 guidance – especially on Analytical Laboratory Test Equipment and other Lab Information Systems
Technical Writing of Validation Documents (Risk Assessment, Validation Plan, Design Configuration/Specification, User Requirements, Functional Requirements, IQ OQ PQ, Trace Matrix, Validation Summary Report), SOPs, Maintenance Procedures, Calibration Procedures, and other instrument support documents
Translate technical information and requirements into qualification/validation test design

Organized and task oriented
Excellent written and oral communication skills – especially on technical topics
Self-directed and motivated individual who is able to operate in a rapidly changing business environment
Customer-oriented, conducting job function with a primary focus on customer satisfaction (internal & external) and ability to deal with customer complaints
Must have a strong command of Microsoft Office Word and Excel and Adobe Acrobat, Microsoft Project
Ability to build consensus among team of stakeholders
Excellent critical thinking/analytical and problem solving skills
Experience with a multitude of laboratory equipment a plus

PROJECT ENGINEER

JOB SUMMARY:
Lead the design effort and serve as the technical focal point for all phases of a project (estimating, sales, manufacture, and set-up of equipment).

REPORTS TO: President
DIRECTS WORK FOR: Engineering Coordinator
RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER FUNCTIONS:

Manufacturing:
The Project Engineer is responsible for coordinating the design and manufacturing function. This requires extended communications during the design phase as well as throughout production with the following elements within manufacturing and for the main purposes as stated:

Materials Manager: Producibility of equipment as designed, review of the Bill-of Material, and resolution of technical problems encountered during manufacture.


Purchasing: Review of the Bill-of-Material in terms of quantity, types, availability, substitutability, and value analysis.


Planning and Scheduling: Design schedule (planned vs. actual) anticipated date that design will be completed and released/approved for manufacture. Rescheduling when necessary because of the need for redesign.


Sales:
Providing design, material selection and data to be used for quoting a job; following up on customer requests and additions, changes with data as needed; advising and providing impacts of any changes to proposal or order once accepted.
Providing constant communication with sales as to the overall progress of the job and any implications that needed for customer updates.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS:

The responsibilities and tasks of this position are as follows, but not limited to:

Maintain the knowledge base which consists of, but is not limited to, processes, documentation, engineering change orders, bills of material, product tables and system logs. Create and evaluate the documentation used in production.
Ability to design to meet requirements, see those requirements are satisfied, while balancing the constraints of time and money.


Must be able to convert customer requirements into design that will result in a finished product that will meet customer’s expectations, be delivered when expected, and at the agreed upon cost.


Responsible for answering technical questions and resolving technical problems regarding the design, operation, and reliability of the subject piece of equipment.


Oversees various phases in the design cycle and coordinates functions with other departments.
Responsible for estimating the hours required for the design effort.


Provides technical assistance to the Operations Manager and Sales Representatives during the sales phase of the project.


Ensures that all deviations from standard or previous designs are annotated and adequately estimated and communicates the cost implications with sales so that the added costs are incorporated into the final sales price of the equipment.


Reviews and signs-off on the final Sales Order, notifies the President or Operations Manager of any deviations from the proposed/agreed upon technical specifications.


Responsible for the design of the equipment, development of customer and internal drawings (utilizing existing drawings whenever possible and their relationship to GPS). Creates the Bill-of-Material or directs support staff to create.


Creates the design schedule, establishes milestones, and manages the design effort to ensure quality and timeliness of the completed design package; or is directly responsible for directing support staff on these tasks and supervises to ensure the outcome.


Utilizes travelers used for tracking engineering work - clock in/out in ProfitKey.


Attends status meetings and provides inputs regarding status of the design. Reports problems and provides solutions with specific action items and due dates.


Minimizes engineering design time to maintain projected profit levels.


Serves as the primary focal point for all technical communications with the customer.
Keeps current with all industry standard specifications and regulating requirements for incorporation into products.


Provides a technical input for any Make/Buy decisions.


Establishes and maintains a design baseline and manages change orders:


Maintains communication with sales rep and any other production staff and is responsible for acting on any communications from the customer that may be categorized as design changes.
Notifies the Operations Manager of all communications and assess the impact of any design changes in terms of cost, delivery time, and quality of designs.
Provides inputs to estimates for change orders.
Obtains final decision from Operations Manager.


Responds to all shop floor feedback regarding technical problems encountered or improvements suggested during manufacture. Manages the problem resolution/suggested improvement process.
Inspects incoming equipment and provides technical expertise as needed or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Completes FAT prior to shipment or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Present during the start-up of equipment at the customer’s facility when directed by the Operations Manager or President.
Create and maintains manuals for company products to be used for installation of equipment.


Creates manuals for all custom jobs or components or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Resolves all technical problems, establishes a data base for identifying and analyzing technical problems with an emphasis on future prevention and design improvements utilizing TQM/SPC concepts and techniques.


Assists in the development of the GPS System Specifications; provides updated data to be entered into system. Helps to create and implement plan for entering data and maintaining parts and product information as needed to ensure system is maintained as a accurate resource for quotes.


Provides direction and technical assistance to lower level engineering tasks such as, but not limited to drafting.


Signs-off/approves all drawings and revisions to drawings.


Assist in the development of marketing materials to support marketing campaigns, literature, and trade shows.


Creates policies and procedures unique to the Engineering function.


Maintains CAD and SolidWorks databases and ensure accurate and timely retrieval of all engineering data.


Integrate Engineering efforts with part numbers, and Bill-of-Material structures or directs staff to complete.


Creates a system to maximize standardization of company products and to effectively deviate from standard designs when necessary.


Designs and maintains a system to ensure the continuous improvement of the engineering function at company and to establish company as a leader in state-of-the-art technology regarding its various product lines.


Manage the transferring of our 2D CAD system to 3D (SolidWorks).


Establishes the policies and procedures for tasks within this role to be performed on a continuing basis for any of the above tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS and SKILLS REQUIRED:
Education level:
 BS in Mechanical Engineering Degree or related area in Engineering


Experience:
5+ years experience working in a similar role or within an engineering firm or department that required similar tasks.
10+ yrs experience with Auto CAD; 5 yrs+ experience with SolidWorks


Specific skills:
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and Outlook)
Proficient in Auto CAD and SolidWorks
Experience with ERP systems required.

PROJECT ENGINEER
Check www.scientificsearch.com for all of our current openings.
JOB SUMMARY:
Lead the design effort and serve as the technical focal point for all phases of a project (estimating, sales, manufacture, and set-up of equipment).

REPORTS TO: President
DIRECTS WORK FOR: Engineering Coordinator
RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER FUNCTIONS:

Manufacturing:
The Project Engineer is responsible for coordinating the design and manufacturing function. This requires extended communications during the design phase as well as throughout production with the following elements within manufacturing and for the main purposes as stated:

Materials Manager: Producibility of equipment as designed, review of the Bill-of Material, and resolution of technical problems encountered during manufacture.


Purchasing: Review of the Bill-of-Material in terms of quantity, types, availability, substitutability, and value analysis.


Planning and Scheduling: Design schedule (planned vs. actual) anticipated date that design will be completed and released/approved for manufacture. Rescheduling when necessary because of the need for redesign.


Sales:
Providing design, material selection and data to be used for quoting a job; following up on customer requests and additions, changes with data as needed; advising and providing impacts of any changes to proposal or order once accepted.
Providing constant communication with sales as to the overall progress of the job and any implications that needed for customer updates.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS:

The responsibilities and tasks of this position are as follows, but not limited to:

Maintain the knowledge base which consists of, but is not limited to, processes, documentation, engineering change orders, bills of material, product tables and system logs. Create and evaluate the documentation used in production.
Ability to design to meet requirements, see those requirements are satisfied, while balancing the constraints of time and money.


Must be able to convert customer requirements into design that will result in a finished product that will meet customer’s expectations, be delivered when expected, and at the agreed upon cost.


Responsible for answering technical questions and resolving technical problems regarding the design, operation, and reliability of the subject piece of equipment.


Oversees various phases in the design cycle and coordinates functions with other departments.
Responsible for estimating the hours required for the design effort.


Provides technical assistance to the Operations Manager and Sales Representatives during the sales phase of the project.


Ensures that all deviations from standard or previous designs are annotated and adequately estimated and communicates the cost implications with sales so that the added costs are incorporated into the final sales price of the equipment.


Reviews and signs-off on the final Sales Order, notifies the President or Operations Manager of any deviations from the proposed/agreed upon technical specifications.


Responsible for the design of the equipment, development of customer and internal drawings (utilizing existing drawings whenever possible and their relationship to GPS). Creates the Bill-of-Material or directs support staff to create.


Creates the design schedule, establishes milestones, and manages the design effort to ensure quality and timeliness of the completed design package; or is directly responsible for directing support staff on these tasks and supervises to ensure the outcome.


Utilizes travelers used for tracking engineering work - clock in/out in ProfitKey.


Attends status meetings and provides inputs regarding status of the design. Reports problems and provides solutions with specific action items and due dates.


Minimizes engineering design time to maintain projected profit levels.


Serves as the primary focal point for all technical communications with the customer.
Keeps current with all industry standard specifications and regulating requirements for incorporation into products.


Provides a technical input for any Make/Buy decisions.


Establishes and maintains a design baseline and manages change orders:


Maintains communication with sales rep and any other production staff and is responsible for acting on any communications from the customer that may be categorized as design changes.
Notifies the Operations Manager of all communications and assess the impact of any design changes in terms of cost, delivery time, and quality of designs.
Provides inputs to estimates for change orders.
Obtains final decision from Operations Manager.


Responds to all shop floor feedback regarding technical problems encountered or improvements suggested during manufacture. Manages the problem resolution/suggested improvement process.
Inspects incoming equipment and provides technical expertise as needed or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Completes FAT prior to shipment or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Present during the start-up of equipment at the customer’s facility when directed by the Operations Manager or President.
Create and maintains manuals for company products to be used for installation of equipment.


Creates manuals for all custom jobs or components or directs Engineering Coordinator to complete this task.


Resolves all technical problems, establishes a data base for identifying and analyzing technical problems with an emphasis on future prevention and design improvements utilizing TQM/SPC concepts and techniques.


Assists in the development of the GPS System Specifications; provides updated data to be entered into system. Helps to create and implement plan for entering data and maintaining parts and product information as needed to ensure system is maintained as a accurate resource for quotes.


Provides direction and technical assistance to lower level engineering tasks such as, but not limited to drafting.


Signs-off/approves all drawings and revisions to drawings.


Assist in the development of marketing materials to support marketing campaigns, literature, and trade shows.


Creates policies and procedures unique to the Engineering function.


Maintains CAD and SolidWorks databases and ensure accurate and timely retrieval of all engineering data.


Integrate Engineering efforts with part numbers, and Bill-of-Material structures or directs staff to complete.


Creates a system to maximize standardization of company products and to effectively deviate from standard designs when necessary.


Designs and maintains a system to ensure the continuous improvement of the engineering function at company and to establish company as a leader in state-of-the-art technology regarding its various product lines.


Manage the transferring of our 2D CAD system to 3D (SolidWorks).


Establishes the policies and procedures for tasks within this role to be performed on a continuing basis for any of the above tasks.

QUALIFICATIONS and SKILLS REQUIRED:
Education level:
 BS in Mechanical Engineering Degree or related area in Engineering


Experience:
5+ years experience working in a similar role or within an engineering firm or department that required similar tasks.
10+ yrs experience with Auto CAD; 5 yrs+ experience with SolidWorks


Specific skills:
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint, and Outlook)
Proficient in Auto CAD and SolidWorks
Experience with ERP systems required.
Project Management training and experience as Project Manager or in a role with responsibility of managing projects preferred
Must be able to support multiple efforts and track progress against timelines
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Exceptional organization and time management skills
Attention to detail
Ability to quickly learn new processes and procedures
Demonstrated ability to make logical decisions
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.


Personal characteristics:
Sense of urgency and ability to withstand demanding work flow.
Patient with solid work ethic; able to deal with routine and repetitive tasks.
Hands-on, results oriented attitude
Capacity to handle fast paced and changing environments
Able to remain flexible and adaptable to change




Please send your resume to Tony DeGulis at tony@scientificsearch.com for consideration and reference job #14885.

Must be familiar with information security concepts and products

Follow Bank’s Technology Development Life Cycle
Perform product evaluation, testing and certification of security products

Demonstrate leadership qualities and skills, including independent decision-making abilities
Sound security engineering principles as background to understanding the workings of the systems and controls that are in place
Strong scripting skills (VBScript, PowerShell, WMI and ADSI)
Proven skills of Microsoft Windows internals
Windows server 2008 onwards
Window desktop Win7 onwards
Roles and Features
Registry principles
Windows Remote Management (WinRM)
Windows Auditing (ACL, SDDL, SACL, DACL)
NTLM, Kerberos, Hashing
Use of certificates for RDP, Network Level Authentication etc.
Windows Hello
Bitlocker
Proven skills with security related Active Directory technologies
Group Policy Objects, SCCM, and SCOM
User, computer, group objects
Security templates
PKI / Certificates
8 years of experience in IT/Consulting.
8 years of experience in Systems Administration/Engineering

Windows Administrator - Security – Nice to Have Skills
Azure AD and security tools (Defender ATP, ATA, Azure Log Analytics) considered a plus

ASAP – 12 months to start

Newark, NJ

The Senior Cybersecurity Engineer ("Engineer") reports to the Director of IT and collaborates closely with members of the IT staff, including the Manager of IT Infrastructure Operations. The Engineer is responsible for day-to-day cybersecurity tasks of the Foundation's IT protective services, risk management, engineering, analysis, and investigations. The Engineer collaborates with the Foundation's IT Infrastructure outsource providers, Foundation staff, consultants, and/or service firms, to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of Foundation technology services. The Engineer oversees and works to improve the Foundation's Security Information and Event Management ("SIEM") competency. The Engineer prototypes, configures, troubleshoots, and maintains an extensive variety of security-focused services, products, and equipment that provide technical and administrative controls. The Engineer recommends products or services best suited for the Foundation's cybersecurity needs.
Our client is a non-for-profit Foundation which believes that the arts and humanities are where we express our complex humanity, and we believe that everyone deserves the beauty, transcendence, and freedom to be found there. Through our grants, we seek to build just communities enriched by meaning and empowered by critical thinking, where ideas and imagination can thrive. It makes grants in four core program areas (Higher Learning, Arts and Culture, Public Knowledge, and Humanities in Place).
Protect, Analyze, and Defend the Network and its Web applications.
Engineer, Operate and Maintain Security to all its systems.
Master's Degree preferred
Various Security Certifications a plus
Experience in the following platforms, systems, applications and network hardware including: Azure, Windows Server, Active Directory, Exchange, and Office365.
Cisco Firepower, Cisco Catalyst. Linux/Centos, TCP/IP, firewall and systems security, network and system monitoring/logging, network switching, and routing, Data Loss Prevention (DLP) business continuity and disaster recovery.
Experience with a hybrid cloud environment (integrating on-premise technology with hosted cloud environment) is highly preferred.

 Certification(s) in one or more of the following areas: GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), CISA: Certified Information Security Auditor, CEH: Certified Ethical Hacker, CISM: Certified Information Security Manager, or CompTIA Security+.
Outstanding Benefits and stable financial organization.
